WRITING.TEXT: I finally decided she needed to be put in her place.
Asking the important questions
Just download the app, it will not disappoint
Thanks for the invite! No BM douchebags so far!

It's just straight up progression. If you've been at this since launch and don't waste gold upgrading stupid cards then you'll be able to compete at this stage. I'm f2p and sit comfortably at 3k with 10/7/3/1 cards.
I got a bunch of bowler and xbow cards from an smc and magic chest. I can't get this deck to work right. What's your general strategy?

This is the best response. Reddit and forum bitching is just a small subset of the players who have difficulties enjoy the game for what it is...a game.
I visit Reddit for some good strategy tips and deck guides. I wish all the complainers would stick to r/clashroyalecirclejerk
I have my bowel movements early in the day. Please don't dictate when I can and can't take a shit.

What do you do when your goblins get zapped during a hog push or when RG is attacking your tower? Would guards work better? And if you're going to sit on 3M most of the match, would it better to bring a rocket to finish a tower?
For double the elixir of an ice wiz :(
Cool, good luck in smc! Looking forward to see how the deck matches up. I always enjoy decks that go against the meta.

I'm absolutely loving this deck and my princes are only level 2. I've been using it in tournament for now. I tweaked it a little based on my original comment. I put in furnace instead of EC and ice wiz instead of princess. Furnace costs less and keeps the pressure on 1 side so it requires an answer, much like princess. Ice wiz as we know is a defensive power house. His ability to slow things down helps generate elixir for a counter. I try to drop double Prince as spirits spawn and drop an ice spirit in the mix. Total destruction. I managed to win vs 2 balloon decks with furnace, ice spirit and ice wiz to defend. Give it a shot and tell me what you think compared to your original deck.
Although not in 5 mins, my brother got the log, princess and miner in 3 days
Seconded, some replays would be great
He said the ideal push was double dark Prince with regular prince

I do neither of these things. All I ever do is say good luck at the start of a match and good game at the end no matter what the outcome was. If I get demolished or if it's a tough battle I'll throw in a well played. No other emotes are necessary. Anyone who loses their shit over this game needs to reevaluate their life choices.
#1 reason why I use the collector

Cool looking deck. It'll be difficult to get my princes up, but I'm going to try it. What do you think about using furnace instead of EC? Seems like the deck could benefit and after watching the video vs RG it didn't look like you really needed the EC.
Fireball zap or rocket them since they stay together and don't split. RG survives all that.
This deck is actually quite fun to play! I dominated a tournament losing only once to a lavahound giant deck that demolished me.
That's what beta is, before the game is released. You just reiterated exactly what I said.
I have that happen sometimes too. But I planting then directly behind your tower is the best way
You could say yes. It was well before the speed nerf and since it was a rare card it was easier to level up
How does it fair in tournaments?

Log has so many other uses too! I tried playing without it and quickly realized how much I've come to rely on it.
Side note, how do you set up the right push with this deck?
Edit: nevermind just saw your thread!

I've been doing this since day 1 and I've never raged after losing a game or getting BM'ed. It's just a game we play for fun anyways. If ranking high on ladder actually mattered for anything maybe I'd feel more competitive.
My brother on the other hand shattered his phone screen after throwing it at a wall when he lost lol
Prince was a rare card in beta...
This basically. Either have zap baited by an IT and use barrel on counter or launch sparky and barrel to lure the zap on either card. A good player will zap sparky and fire spirit/log the goblins.

It has a permanent place in my deck. It's seriously a versatile card. Rush of barbs? Log. Hog coming in? Log + something cheap. That valk or mini p coming in at half health and about to take a swipe at your tower? Log. Goblin barrel about to land? Drop that log.
So many more uses. The most important being a positive elixir trade to princess. My suggestion? Learn to use it now, I'm sure a buff is coming.
Bomber works nearly as well and provides and great push with just a giant and fire spirits. I had the deck A9 with bomber and fireball instead of log and ice wiz

This right here. Super fun deck to play. The good players will zap sparky and fire spirit your barrel. In this situation have minions or horde too. If that gets countered then go for a draw and try your luck vs someone else.

I run a vastly different deck. I don't believe in the RG cancer.
3M, giant, knight (sub miner), fire spirits, goblins, elixir collector, log, ice wiz (sub princess or bomber).
Basically log is a great combo with ice wiz, princess, knight, bomber, even spirits or gobs. Those units turn to offense, and you get the added benefit of a cheap 2 elixir princess killer.

It has a permanent place in my decks. It has many benefits that I'm too lazy to list but its versatility with other cards is great. Also as someone else stated, it's more than likely going to get buffed.
Oh well, I do what works for me. Anyone worth their salt can beat me to get into A9
I rarely lose unless I'm throwing the match to stay in the 3000-3100 range. I don't waste my time fighting above 3100 right now.
Can confirm, A9 flooded with high cards as a fresh level 9. Cancer causing level 11 RG everywhere.
Figuratively unplayable

This is basically what I do. Either join late or don't battle for a bit then just roflstomp my way up. I feed on the tears of top 10 players. I fished #1 in my first few tournaments then gave up on it. Too much effort required.

It's because of the fucking stupid RG meta. I'm sitting between 3000-3300 with 2 accounts and 75% of the time I have to battle level 11 RG with the occasional 12. On the bright side, beating them half the time is a bit rewarding.
Spread the love, would like to use this!
The calibri look down on you
ALL fonts matter... Except maybe windings
Grammar justice warriors are killing me
Fixed!!! Unless I'm supposed to put the she first.... Fuck
****ought to have!!!

WRITING.TEXT: Can confirm. Have log, much amaze.
Nor will he put it in her first...
**without
All very good points. Guess we're just going to wait and see what they do.

I'm not asking for an immediate update. And many will agree they fucked up with the last patch. It was a huge money grab for them. I'd be OK if they took a few months to figure it and get it right, but what's the player base going to be like if nothing changes until then?
100% agree. Just look at the poorly implemented tournament mode. It's dried up fast now that most of the f2p players earned their hosting achievement

3M, giant, knight, ice wiz, log, gobs, spirits and EC. It has its hard counters, but fairs well more often than not. Someone had put up a guide about it before, I modified it a little and found good success. It does great in tourneys vs weaker RG and I'll typically win before OT
u/ClashRoyale where you at?

I enjoy the game for many of the same reasons you mentioned in your video. Barring no significant changes in the next update, would you see yourself ultimately quitting?
Even with all the ranting going on, I feel like SC will fix things. They've shown they're willing to listen in some of the previous updates/QoL changes they added.
No longer murders princess or skeletons
It's the only spell in my deck right now. I've got counters for everything else except sparky. But I've adapted to dealing with her with zap.

The only things that keep me going is ease of play and exploring new deck ideas. I always look for ways to get away from the current meta and make something different work. I'm fortunate that I've got a deck that's working well but doesn't have RG, hog, miner or even a mini pekka.
That's promising I guess? But will it be too little too late. I've gotten a bunch of people into the game but many quit when they hit the playhouse shit show

There's a lot less now than before. Not many people are willing to shell out money to host a tourney for shitty winnings. It also comes down to location. I have a feeling if SC do away with the stupid gem cost it'll be much easier to get in tournaments
Maybe, but I still feel like many people agree that this next one will be pivotal.
Don't take away my log! Seriously, after ice wiz it's my favorite card.
I think it depends of the meta and your deck. If you're doing a usual RG or hog deck everyone builds in a counter for those.
I think an overhauled tournament mode would be sufficient. The only purpose it currently serves is to test out new decks
Let them tremble

WRITING.TITLE: Next major update will either make or break the game
WRITING.TEXT:
Anyone else feel like they're just currently going through the motions with this game? Opening chests, requesting cards, maintaining trophy level.
There's been numerous posts about the current state of the game. ChiefPat's video had the most clear points of what SC could do to help the game. So I'm not going to get into those details.
I just wanted to see who else is eagerly awaiting SC's next big update. I'm curious to learn if they've taken anything the community has said into account. In my opinion, the next update is going to make or break this game for a lot of people, myself included. Even simply adding a couple more legendaries might be enough to drive me away.
If you've noticed this guy and his good ideas, I hope you listened to chief pat.

Hey I had to follow up. I went back to your original 3M deck and it's an absolute wrecking ball. The only adjustment I made was replacing FB with Log that I got yesterday. It makes the deck more flexible on those counters. Sparky is still my biggest problem though. How do you manage it usually? I typically drop giant and hope 2M are far enough not to get obliterated. I have about a 50% win rate against sparky.
Not currently, I dropped down to 2500 to experiment with fun decks. Thanks for the offer though. I think a lot of people would be interested in a write up

If I was to guess you're strategy, seems like you hold rocket unless there's something good to counter, 3M, collector, etc. Then you're trying to get the giant to the tower with every push so you can chip away until it's rocketable. You've got variations on your pushes, but giant seems to be the corner stone of it all.
How do you keep RG damage to a minimum? And if you have any legendaries which would you sub in?
Dat Larry though, much calcium

I sat in legendary for a while then I got bored of the struggle to keep my chests going. I dropped back down to 2500 and now enjoy using random decks that seem fun. People still offer a challenge and I'll rarely lose (unless on purpose to keep trophies low).
I'm truly impressed. Fuck most of the idiots in this sub. How does this perform in tournaments? What's the general idea behind your strategy?
Could anything replace the miner? Damn card keeps eluding me. I got the log today
Error: Does not compute
Deck?
To get your friends/clan mates in before opening it up the public

I'm getting close to level 10 as well. I sit in arena 7 by choice. Arena 8 has a lot of hard fought battles and on most days I don't have time to battle 30 times to get my crown chest. Sitting in arena 7 I can get it done much quicker. Yeah I'm missing out on a few cards and gold, but sitting in arena 7 has the added benefit of allowing me to test various decks for fun.

I've been flip flopping back and forth between both these variations. They both have their pros and cons. I just wanted to thank you for the original deck idea. I'm having a blast with it and getting away from the meta is my favorite part! The biggest learning curve was being OK with sacrificing a tower in order to build the push. Most wins are 3 crowns.
Thanks again
Spirits and FB together felt a bit redundant. Faster reaction with zap and helps a lot with sparky. The biggest drawback is you can't FB their pump.

Your comment gave me an idea. I subbed out giant for sparky. Switched knight for valk and zap for FB(cheapen the deck and counter sparky). Using your general strategy I've been having huge success. Primarily because sparky needs attention when played. Bonus she'll blow up any barbarians dropped on the 2 Musks behind it.
Are you having an easier time with the deck after the xbow buff? Did you swap cannon after the nerf?
What could you sub in for princess?
What's your deck? I was trying one with xbow sparky but topped out at 2850

I actually want to play more and more. I have two accounts. After reaching A8, my main just trolls around in lower A7, testing new decks and having fun. I can easily get it back into A8 if I feel like it. But I have the most fun trying different things. My second account is also in A7, I focus on 1 deck that has always worked for me (level 8 account with a couple level 10 commons and 7 rares). I keep my chest slots full and crown completed on both accounts.
I've stopped playing clash of clans and boom beach because of this game. It requires little effort compared to the others.
I've considered starting a 3rd account so I can battle high level players in lower arenas.
I get enjoyment out of the game by not worrying about legendaries, p2w barriers or trophies. I enjoy it purely for the fun strategy and ease of play.
That's right it is. And that means you pay nothing to play unless you choose to support the game developers. Be glad the whales at the top spend so much.
What's your deck/trophies?

It's an RG cycle deck. It's all about keeping the pressure on. If I see a pump go down I'll be pushing right away. You never let them play how want. I don't want until 10 elixir at the start either. If I have an RG in my hand he's played almost immediately. It either takes them off guard or ruins their set up.
Defend and counter with sparky. I'll only drop a sparky as an aggressor if I'm full on elixir and there's no hog to just drop while I wait.

9 zap cannon, 7 hog, 6 for the rest, 1 sparky/IW. That got me into A8. After I got my mini p and wiz to 7 I topped out at 3300. Good players with a miner deck were giving me trouble. Everything else I could compete with.

Currently testing this deck to much success: RG, spear gobs, tombstone, fire spirits, minions, mini p, zap and ice wiz (sub in stab gobs or archers). This is a bit of a variation on yarn's RG cycle deck. Some use hog, but I like mini p for the current meta.

If you're looking for a sparky deck, try this: mini p, hog, wiz, ice wiz, collector, cannon (may change to Tombstone), zap and sparky. Use sparky only on defense, deploy wizard with him on counter. If you have a collector down, you should be able to deploy mini p and hog in the other lane with zap ready. Both pushes require an answer or they'll lose a tower. My experience is the hog mini p does most of the tower killing. Sparky is best for defense and a distraction.
I took this deck to 3300, miner cycle or hog cycle can be difficult, but not impossible.
I haven't used Tombstone in months. I decided to try it again and the first match was a hog mini p and pekka deck. Frustration ensued for my opponent.
